text:
People say the next
generation is India's.

However, for farmers who
represent 50% of India's
population, this is not true.

They've been excluded
from India's growth story.
We are here to change that.

Today, 100 million
marginal farmers in India

do not have access to
affordable irrigation.

Meanwhile, India's dependence
on fossil fuel-based irrigation

systems contributes 4%
of India's net emissions.

At Solara, we are
democratizing access

to clean and
affordable irrigation.

We have deployed a large
network of solar irrigation kits
that are shareable.

On our digital platform, farmers
will be able to book time
with these sessions.

And they'll be able to pay for
irrigation only for the time
that they use the kits.

The impact of our
service is profound.

We are cutting the cost
of irrigation for farmers
down in half.

We're doubling farmer incomes
for more productive harvest
yields.

And we're eliminating
a car's worth

of carbon dioxide
emissions for every acre
that we solarize every year.
My name is Rea Savla.

My cofounder,
Vishesh Mehta, and I

have experience building
grassroots development projects
in India.

We also have a background in
strategy and technical program
management.

Over the course
of the past year,

we have been on an expedition
across four states and 22

villages, speaking to
hundreds of farmers

to ensure that our
solution is rooted

in the needs of the communities
that we are serving.

Affordable irrigation is
deeply personal to me.

My grandmother was a
smallholder farmer in India.

And by access to
Solara's service,

farmers like her will be able
to pay their medical bills,

send their daughters to
school past the seventh grade,

and access other opportunities
that my grandmother never
received.

This is the impact that we
are catalyzing with Solara.

And we invite you to
join us on this journey.
Thank you.
[APPLAUSE]
